angular.questionText: 1)AngularJS expressions bind AngularJS data to HTML the same way as the _________ directive.
angular.explanation: AngularJS expressions bind AngularJS data to HTML the same way as the ng-bind directive.

angular.questionText: 2)Which of the following is an Advantages of AngularJS?

options.text: c)AngularJS uses dependency injection and make use of separation of concerns.

angular.explanation: All of the above statement is an Advantages of AngularJS.

angular.questionText: 3)All of the above statement is an Advantages of AngularJS
angular.explanation: Data binding in AngularJS is the synchronization between the model and the view.

angular.questionText: 4)The [] parameter in the module definition can be used to define dependent modules.
angular.explanation: The [] parameter in the module definition can be used to define dependent modules. Without the [] parameter, you are not creating a new module, but retrieving an existing one.

angular.questionText: 5)Which of the following is used to share data between controller and view in AngularJS?
angular.explanation: using services is the correct answer.
